source.7f3c89db:
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd 
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas_bokeh as pb
pb.output_notebook()
import seaborn as sns
source.2b79dada:
responses= pd.read_csv('../input/kaggle-survey-2020/kaggle_survey_2020_responses.csv')
columns = responses.iloc[0,:]
responses.columns = columns
responses = responses.drop(responses.index[0])
source.8c0356cc:
ages = responses['What is your age (# years)?'].value_counts()
ages = ages.sort_index()
ages.name = 'Years'
source.d9d4e912:
plt.figure(figsize=(12,6))
plt.title('Age distribution of kaggle users')
sns.barplot(x = ages.index, y=ages)
source.32dc1311:
gender = responses['What is your gender? - Selected Choice'].value_counts()
gender.name = 'Gender'
source.2bcdfc95:
instruction = responses['What is the highest level of formal education that you have attained or plan to attain within the next 2 years?'].value_counts()
instruction.name='instruction'
source.4ae669db:
instruction_x_gender = pd.crosstab(responses['What is the highest level of formal education that you have attained or plan to attain within the next 2 years?'],responses['What is your gender? - Selected Choice'])
instruction_x_gender.columns.name = 'Gender'
instruction_x_gender.index.name = 'Instruction'
source.1d4f5451:
gender_x_age = pd.crosstab(responses['What is your age (# years)?'],responses['What is your gender? - Selected Choice'])
gender_x_age.columns.name  = 'Gender'
gender_x_age.index.name = 'Age'
source.c604ec22:
age_x_inst = pd.crosstab(responses['What is your age (# years)?'],responses['What is the highest level of formal education that you have attained or plan to attain within the next 2 years?'])
age_x_inst.index.name = 'Age'
age_x_inst.columns.name = 'Education'
source.b73566df:
man = responses[responses['What is your gender? - Selected Choice']=='Man']
woman = responses[responses['What is your gender? - Selected Choice']=='Woman']
age_x_inst_man =  pd.crosstab(man['What is your age (# years)?'],man['What is the highest level of formal education that you have attained or plan to attain within the next 2 years?'])
age_x_inst_woman =  pd.crosstab(woman['What is your age (# years)?'],woman['What is the highest level of formal education that you have attained or plan to attain within the next 2 years?'])

source.11bee2e5:
frame = [frame for frame in responses.columns if 'Which of the following machine learning frameworks do you use on a regular basis? (Select all that apply) - Selected Choice -' in frame]

lista=[]
indexs = []
for i in range(0,len(frame)):
    indexs =  np.append(indexs,frame[i].split(' - Selected Choice - ')[1])
    lista = np.append(lista,responses[frame[i]].value_counts())
source.27e7fa79: ### Look [here](https://www.kaggle.com/domizianostingi/kaggle-users-around-the-world) for a world distribution of the kaggle users
source.2519015a: ### Data visualitation of the dataset, I'm trying to use both seaborn and bokeh, this latter is quite new for me, so this is an opportunity to learn. I'm also using pandas.plot for crosstable data
source.4a72b1b5: It is not quite simple use seaborn or bokeh with table data. I will then use pandas.plot option (at the end of the day both seaborn and pandas plots are derivation of matplotlib)
